intro: Rosa davurica var. alpestris, commonly known as the alpine rose, is a cold-hardy shrub native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is characterized by its compact growth habit, with grayish-green leaves and fragrant, pink to white flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant thrives in well-drained, rocky soils and is adapted to high-altitude environments. Its horticultural value lies in its ornamental appeal and ability to withstand harsh climatic conditions. It is often used in rock gardens and alpine landscapes due to its resilience and beauty.
